story_summary: Fyodor Pavlovitch becomes increasingly drunk and irritable, discussing his disdain for Russia and his complicated views on God, immortality, and the monks with Ivan and Alyosha. He reminisces about his mother and his past, which triggers a sudden emotional outburst from Alyosha, who begins to weep violently. The chapter ends abruptly as Dmitri bursts in, causing Fyodor Pavlovitch to panic and cling to Ivan for protection.
